intro: Hiraea cuneata var. acuminata, commonly known as the narrowleaf hiraea, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically arranged in clusters, often in shades of pink or red. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or scrub habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is not widely commercially available.
